intro: Blastus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf blastus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
